agenda.description: HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Licensing & Administrative Procedures TIME & DATE: 8:00 AM, Tuesday, April 16, 2019 PLACE: E2.028 CHAIR: Rep. Tracy King HB 1972 Collier Relating to municipal regulation of game rooms and amusement redemption machines. HB 1533 Collier Relating to a political subdivision's adoption of zoning regulations for certain coin-operated machines. HB 1873 Dominguez Relating to a report by the Texas Division of Emergency Management regarding building trade services following disasters. HB 4233 Kuempel | et al. Relating to the labeling of wine as originating from this state. HB 2112 Thompson, Ed Relating to salvage motor vehicles, including flood vehicles, and nonrepairable motor vehicles. HB 2602 Thompson, Senfronia | et al. Relating to the operation of a motor vehicle dealership by certain manufacturers. HB 3988 Raney Relating to the filing fee for a complaint concerning the failure of a manufacturer, converter, or distributor to conform a motor vehicle to certain express warranties. HB 3768 Burrows | et al. Relating to authorizing tastings by certain alcoholic beverage manufacturers at certain events. HB 3415 King, Ken Relating to package store permits. HB 3174 Kuempel Relating to covers or barriers on the windows and doors of and other obstructions of the view of certain alcoholic beverage retailers. HB 2793 Goldman | et al. Relating to certain presumptions relating to the sale of alcoholic beverages. HB 4226 Nevárez Relating to the creation of the Trades Board of the State of Texas; the licensure and regulation of plumbers, electricians, and air conditioning and refrigeration contractors; authorizing a fee. HB 3229 Bucy Relating to the hours of instruction required for driver training. HB 849 Guillen Relating to the status and taxation of powdered alcohol as an alcoholic beverage. HB 1610 Ashby | et al. Relating to powdered alcohol. HB 4245 Bailes Relating to the percentage of voters needed to sign a petition requesting a local option election to prohibit or authorize the sale of alcoholic beverages. HB 1857 Goldman Relating to an exemption from the plumbing licensing law for plumbing work performed on certain private property. NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
